subject: dreport: add PLDM fru record table to the BMC dump
commitMessage:
dreport: add PLDM fru record table to the BMC dump

Execute the PLDM fru record table command and redirect the
output to pldm_fru_record_table.txt and append the file
to the BMC dump

Tested:

            "FRU Record Set Identifier": 1,
            "FRU Record Type": "General(1)",
            "Number of FRU fields": 4,
            "Encoding Type for FRU fields": "ASCII(1)"

Signed-off-by: Marri Devender Rao <devenrao@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I054d39055f9eb8a36446abe67602de1113ba4186

dreport:
Done
typo
Done

@Sampa is it ok to include only in the user requested BMC dump? or Do we need other types of BMC dumps too? 

FYR: https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/blob/master/tools/dreport.d/sample.conf#L7
I am ok with a user-initiated dump, we can enable it if needed in the future.
can we add this to all dumps ? instead of user dumps. This would be give a full view of bmc inventory & i think it would be value add if we have this captured for all the dumps.

is it possible to have a timeout for this command ? 

in the sense..if pldmtool is hung waiting for the response, does the collection on dump wait for eternity ?

Yes, it would. This is a limitation in the current dump collection framework. We'll either need -
1/ each of the called applications to handle timeouts 
2/ the dump collection framework to implement a mechanism to detect and terminate the running command

can't we do something like :

pldmtool fru getfrurecordtable > /tmp/pldm_get_fru_record_table &
sleep 5
kill "$!"
copy /tmp/pldm_get_fru_record_table  /dump

? 

I am not an expert in dump - but i guess i am okay if we dont have a way to handle time out for now.
@manoj, when the tool hit timeout? Tool is not internally handling timeouts?

pldmtool does not implement async mecahnism & it does not have timeouts or retries like a normal pldm stack.

As it is sync - once the request is sent - pldmtool will be blocked until the reply message appears back on the mctp socket. if that does not come - we will be hangaing there forever.
This is dangerous , if somebody tried user initiated dump during boot window. This can bri9ng the system down for timeout issue.
